section.h2: Top played tracks from the last month

section.div: Favorites genres: Action, Comedy, Fantasy, Drama, Romance

div.div: The second season of Mairimashita! Iruma-kun. Suzuki Iruma, human and deeply non-aggressive, one day becomes the grandson of the great demon Sullivan. Doted on beyond belief, Iruma starts school where "Grandpa" serves as the chair... and finds, to his surprise, that he enjoys life there with Asmodeus, Clara, and the rest of his demon classmates. But just when Iruma thought he'd fitted in, there's more trouble ahead! A ring begins to talk, and Iruma... goes bad?! Iruma's chaotic, demonic life at school continues! (Source: NHK)

In the year 1333, the Kamakura shogunate government comes crumbling down. A trusted vassal, Ashikaga Takauji, betrays the shogunate and organizes a rebellion. Houjou Tokiyuki, the rightful heir, escapes the massacre with a Shinto priest named Suwa Yorishige to Kamakura. On the run and fighting to stay alive, Tokiyuki sets in motion his plan to reclaim his birthright.
(Source: Crunchyroll)
Seijo no Maryoku wa Bannou desu

Sei, a 20-year-old office worker, is whisked away to a whole new world. Unfortunately for Sei, the ritual that summoned her—meant to produce a “Saint” who would banish the dark magic—brought two people over instead of one. And everyone prefers the second girl over Sei?! But this is just fine by Sei, who leaves the royal palace to set up shop making potions and cosmetics with her newfound magic. Business is booming, and this might not be such a bad life, after all…as long as her supposed Sainthood doesn’t come back to haunt her.
(Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)
Akuyaku Reijou desu ga, Shiawase ni Natte Misemasu wa!

Annuled engagements, "serves you right"s, condemnation events, doting, royalty, reincarnated heroines, banishment endings... it's fully loaded with all the charms of villainesses!! Despite all the Villainess' stories starting off in dire straits, in the end they're...all happy endings♪ A comicalization of popular villainess stories that were published on Shousetsuka ni Narou! An anthology of oneshots with happy endings!! Volume 1 Cover illustration: Maro 1. "The Villainess Will Obtain True Love" by Hoshino Soumei Author: Nekomata Doremi An annulled engagement at a graduation party?! 2. "The Tale of the Noble Girl who will go to a Monastery after her Engagement Annulment" by Sorakura SHIJIKI, Author: Yuuki Satoru Banishment after her younger sister steals her fiance?! 3. "I Will Definitely Get My Engagement Annulled! ~I will become a Villainess!" by Kuroe Yui, Author: Reiga Utsuho To break off her engagement, she harasses the daughter of a Baron?! 4. "Shall We Walk Hand in Hand Down the Flowery Path of Evil?" by Yamashiro Umeta, Author: Mafuyubi After her engagement is annulled, she gets married to a fat old baldy?! 5. "The Villainess Trifles with the Second Prince's First Love" by Oshitsuji Ei, Author: Mizuno Saaya After being condemned, the second prince appears before me... Volume 2 Cover illustration: Maro 1. "It's Been 10 Years Since You Asked to Break Off Our Engagement, If You Insist That Much, Let's Break It Off!" by Maro, Author: Yoshimura She's been told multiple times since they were young to break off the engagement?! 2. "The Villainess Laughs Innocently" by Oshitsuji Ei, Author: Yoruru A Condemnation Event after being called out to the rear garden?! 3. "The Art of Rebuilding a Nation Begins with a Broken Engagement!" by Kawano Akiko, Author: Hazuki The Prince has an affair with the Saintess and calls off his engagement?! 4. "You Were Set Up, You Know?" by Koyuki Iroha, Author: Yuki Yukiko At the graduation party, my older sister's engagement was broken?! 5. "The Villainess Exploded" by Nanso, Author: bouro The Villainess tells the Second Prince "Serves you right"?! 6. "I Reincarnated as a Villainess. Come Quickly, my Engagement Breaking Event" by Mochida Moo, Author: Kyouka The only ally the reincarnated Villainess has is the butler?!
How do you use Aeron MDS with multiple publishers and a single subscriber where the publishers are unaware of the subscriber machine IPs?

I am trying to use Aeron Multi-Destination-Subscriptions where I have multiple publishers publish messages to their own IP address and port. I want a subscriber to subscribe to each of the publishers IP addresses and PORTs on the same stream ID. The publishers and subscribers are on separate machines. For simplicity, I'm testing this with a single Publisher and Subscriber setup. I am using docker to create a virtual network so I can designate the IPs of the publisher and subscriber machines. Here is my example code: Publication code final String publicationChannel = new ChannelUriStringBuilder() .media(UDP_MEDIA) (3 more lines were trimmed) Subscription code final String subscriptionChannel = new ChannelUriStringBuilder() .media(UDP_MEDIA) (8 more lines were trimmed) I have a doWork in both of these which repeatedly call subscription.isConnected() and publication.isConnected(). I expected this to work just like the MDC example where you can use control-mode=manual on the publication side and call publication.addDestination(subscriberIP:port) where the subscription would be setup to subscribe to its own subscriberIP:port. In testing, the publication and subscription are not connected. This test class in the aeron repo uses MDS over UDP using localhost and using multicast addresses MDSTest so I thought the same would hold true for using the publisher machines IP and port. Would really appreciate if someone could explain why this doesn't work?
